intro: Cnestis leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered cnestis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, dry seeds.
